meanings.definition: To act in an excessively subservient manner; to grovel or show excessive deference.
meanings.sent1: He would kotow to his boss by constantly praising her work.
meanings.sent2: It is not necessary to kotow to others to gain their approval.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to kotow to the cat, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: She refused to kotow to unjust demands, standing up for her beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The knight's decision to kotow to the king's every whim led to his downfall.

meanings.definition: A deep bow or act of kneeling in Chinese culture as a sign of respect or submission.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, he performed a graceful kotow before the emperor.
meanings.sent2: The kotow symbolized his reverence for the ancient traditions.
meanings.sent3: The kotow in the play was so exaggerated, it made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kotow before the master painter was a gesture of admiration for his skill.
meanings.sent5: The kotow of the young prince was a poignant display of his loyalty to the kingdom.
